title: About
text:
Outside of my studies and work I am avid surfer, backpacker, diver, and mushroom hunter; among many other outdoor hobbies. I love spending time outdoors and learning about nature.

Some Photos of my Hobbies how do I make lighbox work


















I made this website with Quarto, R, and GitHub. Check out my repository here  .

title: Environmental Science
text:
Some of my favorite Environmental Science Courses

Field Study of California’s Coast

We visited various sites along the coast that had restoration projects and interesting physical and social geographic features.
Research project on the effects of seasonal changes in kelp forest density on beach wrack and beach productivity.
Performed native plant identification and did vegetation transect surveys.
Taught by Ian Walker





Doing vegetation cover studies on dune restoration project at Santa Monica Beach.



Stats for Environmental Science

Learned about descriptive statistics, analyzing differences between populations, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and types of bias. We applied all these concepts in RStudio data analysis.
Taught by An Bui

Applied Ecology

This class taught me about ecological concepts and discussed them in the context of current challenges in environmental management and conservation.
Taught by Claudia Tyler



My Other Cool Env Sci Courses

Meteorology

Leila Carvalho

Ocean Circulation

Tim DeVries

title: Geographic Information Systems and Science
text:
My Interest in GIS 
I have an emphasis in Geography within my Environmental Studies Major. I took the three class series on Geographic Information Systems and Science (GIS) that the UCSB Geography Department offers.
The series included:

Intro to GIS

Basic spatial data management and display in ArcGIS Pro.
Taught by Professor Somayeh Dodge




Technical Issues in GIS

Technical issues underlying geographic information systems.
Taught by Professor Alan Murray




GIS Applications

Planning, design, analysis, and presentation of a GIS pilot study.
I am currently working on a suitability analysis for prescribed burn and forest mastication areas in Yosemite National Park in ArcGIS Pro.
Taught by Professor Peter Kedron

title: Environmental Policy
text:
Some of my favorite Environmental Policy Courses

Public Lands and Waters - Law and Policy

Introduction to law and policy surrounding public lands and waters.
This course was extremely comprehensive. It provided me with an excellent understanding of our public lands are currently and have been managed and how we can have a say in this management.
Taught by Professor Deborah Williams





Gates of the Arctic © John Schoen



Principles of Environmental Planning

Introduction to the history, theory, trends, and practice of environmental land use planning in California.
Provided in depth education how NEPA and CEQA play a role in zoning and development.
Our final project guided us through attending a local Planning Commission meeting and doing a report on the various aspects that go into putting a project through all fo the required processes.
Taught by Dan Klemann

title: Dylan Freebairn-Smith
text:
Welcome!
Welcome to my website, thanks for visiting! I’m Dylan Freebairn-Smith and I made this website to catalog just some of my studies at UCSB!
I am from a small town called Gualala in Southern Mendocino County. I love challenging myself intellectually and physically, both professionally and in my free time.
For now this website showcases my courses from the main three categories that I studied at UC Santa Barbara: GIS, Environmental Science, and Environmental Policy. I hope to expand it in the future to encompass more of my accomplishments and interests!


Education
Environmental Studies B.A. (2024) | University of California, Santa Barbara
Point Arena High School (2020)
